alert.note: Alert for Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 12:50AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lowndes and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1249 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pintlala, or 11 miles southwest of Montgomery. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Hunter, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Alabama State University, Hope Hull, Woodcrest, Dannelly Field, Maxwell Air Force Base, Snowdoun, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium, Pinedale, Gunter Air Force Base, Pintlala, Alabama State Capitol and Manack. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
